cartUnlockWorker.read:
Dumping cartridge...
Do not turn off the 573.
cartUnlockWorker.x76f041Error:
An error occurred while attempting to unlock the cartridge; the key is probably incorrect. If you are sure you selected the proper key, the maximum allowed number of failed unlocking attempts may have been exceeded (and thus the cartridge may have been bricked).

Error code: %s
Press the Test button to view debug logs.
cartUnlockWorker.x76f100Error:
An error occurred while attempting to unlock the cartridge; the key is probably incorrect. If you are sure you selected the proper key, the cartridge may have self-erased and reset the key to a null key due to too many failed unlocking attempts.

Error code: %s
Press the Test button to view debug logs.
cartUnlockWorker.zs01Error:
An error occurred while attempting to unlock the cartridge; the key is probably incorrect. If you are sure you selected the proper key, the cartridge may have self-erased and reset the key to a null key due to too many failed unlocking attempts.

Error code: %s
Press the Test button to view debug logs.

cartDumpWorker.save:
Saving cartridge dump...
Do not turn off the 573 or unplug drives.

An error occurred while saving the dump. Turn off the system and make sure the drive is connected to the IDE bus properly, set as secondary (if a CD-ROM drive is also present) and formatted with a single FAT16, FAT32 or exFAT partition.

romEraseWorker.unsupported:
The flash memory chips on this device are unresponsive to commands or are currently unsupported. If you are trying to erase a PCMCIA card with a write protect switch, make sure the switch is off.

See the documentation for more information on supported flash chips.

atapiEjectWorker.noDrive:
No ATAPI CD-ROM drive has been found on the IDE bus or could be successfully initialized. Your drive might be incompatible with the ATAPI driver used by this tool.

Press the Test button to view debug logs.
atapiEjectWorker.ejectError:
Failed to open the drive's tray. Your drive might be incompatible with the ATAPI driver used by this tool.

Press the Test button to view debug logs.

ButtonMappingScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Select button mapping
ButtonMappingScreen.prompt: Use {START_BUTTON} or the Test button to select a mapping preset suitable for your cabinet or JAMMA setup. Other buttons will be enabled once a mapping is selected.
ButtonMappingScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press and hold {START_BUTTON} or Test to confirm

CardSizeScreen.title: Select card size
CardSizeScreen.body: Select the size of the PCMCIA flash card currently inserted in the selected slot, as it cannot be detected automatically.

CartActionsScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Cartridge options
CartActionsScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back

qrDump.name: Dump cartridge as QR code
qrDump.prompt: Generate a QR code encoding the contents of the cartridge's EEPROM in compressed format. The code can be scanned and decoded to a raw dump.

hddDump.name: Dump cartridge to hard drive
hddDump.prompt: Save the contents of the cartridge's EEPROM to a file on the IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).

hexdump.name: View cartridge hexdump
hexdump.prompt: Display the raw contents of the cartridge's EEPROM in hexadecimal format.

hddRestore.name: Restore cartridge from dump
hddRestore.prompt: Wipe all data and restore the cartridge's contents from a previously saved dump on the CD-ROM, IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).
hddRestore.filePrompt: Note that the dump must have the same chip type, and should have the same DS2401 ID (if any), as the cartridge.
hddRestore.confirm:
The contents of the cartridge's EEPROM will be altered and the unlocking key updated to match the selected dump.

Do you wish to proceed?

reflash.name: Erase and convert cartridge to another game
reflash.prompt: Wipe all data and flash the cartridge with another game's identifiers. All cartridges can be converted for use with any other game that uses the same cartridge type.
reflash.confirm:
The contents of the cartridge's EEPROM will be replaced, the system identifier (if any) will be cleared and the unlocking key will be updated to match the new game.

Do you wish to proceed?

erase.name: Erase cartridge
erase.prompt: Wipe all data including game identifiers. Erased cartridges can be flashed for use with games unsupported by this tool using a master calendar.
erase.confirm:
The contents of the cartridge's EEPROM will be erased, making it unusable until reflashed and resetting the unlocking key to 00-00-00-00-00-00-00-00. The cartridge ID will not be altered.

Do you wish to proceed?

resetSystemID.name: Reset system identifier (unpair cartridge)
resetSystemID.prompt: Delete any previously saved system identifier, allowing the cartridge to be used to reinstall the game on any system.
resetSystemID.confirm:
The system identifier will be cleared, allowing the cartridge to be used on a system with any digital I/O board. The game will have to be reinstalled in order to pair the cartridge to the new board.

Do you wish to proceed?
resetSystemID.error: The system identifier is not present or has already been cleared on this cartridge.

matchSystemID.name: Copy system identifier (pair to this system)
matchSystemID.prompt: Set the saved system identifier to allow the cartridge to be used on this system without having to reinstall the game first.
matchSystemID.confirm:
The system identifier will be changed, allowing the cartridge to be used on this system. If already installed here, the game will not have to be reinstalled.

Do you wish to proceed?
matchSystemID.error: No digital I/O board found. Copying the system identifier requires a digital I/O board to be installed in this system.

editSystemID.name: Edit system identifier (pair to another I/O board)
editSystemID.prompt: Edit the saved system identifier to allow the cartridge to be used on a specific system without having to reinstall the game first.
editSystemID.confirm:
The system identifier will be changed, allowing the cartridge to be used on the respective system. If already installed on the new system, the game will not have to be reinstalled.

Do you wish to proceed?
editSystemID.error: The system identifier entered is invalid. Make sure all digits are correct and try again.

digitalIO.error: Failed to read the board's DS2401

cart.x76f041Info:
Chip type:		Xicor X76F041
  Unlock status:	%s
  DS2401 ID:		%s
  Configuration:	%s

cart.zs01Info:

  Unlock status:	%s
  DS2401 ID:		%s
  ZS01 ID:		%s
  Configuration:	%s

pairing.unsupported: This game does not pair to I/O boards
pairing.unknown: Unlock required to view pairing status
pairing.unpaired: Not paired to any digital I/O board
pairing.thisSystem: Paired to this system's I/O board

description.noCart:
No supported cartridge has been found.

Turn off the system and insert a security cartridge in order to continue. DO NOT HOTPLUG CARTRIDGES; hotplugging may damage both the 573 and the cartridge.

If a cartridge is inserted but not detected, try cleaning its pins as well as the system's security cartridge connector.

Press the Test button to view debug logs.
description.initError:
Failed to initialize and read unprotected data from this cartridge.

Turn off the system and make sure the cartridge is inserted correctly. If this issue persists, try using another cartridge of the same type.

locked.unidentified:
This cartridge contains data for an unsupported game.

As the cartridge is currently locked, you will have to manually select which game it belongs to in order to dump its contents or reflash it for use with a supported game, as each game has a different unlocking key.
locked.identified:
This cartridge has been identified as:
  %s
  %s

If this is correct, you may proceed to unlock the cartridge using the appropriate key for this game.
locked.unknown:
This cartridge cannot be identified without unlocking it first.

You will have to manually select which game it belongs to in order to dump its contents or reflash it for use with a supported game, as each game has a different unlocking key.

unlocked.unidentified:
This cartridge contains data for an unsupported game.

The system identifier (if any) cannot be reset or edited, however you may still dump the cartridge's contents or reflash it for use with a supported game.
unlocked.identified:
This cartridge has been identified as:
  %s
  %s

You may now proceed to reset the system identifier, edit it or reflash the cartridge for use with another game.
unlocked.blank:
This cartridge has been previously erased and is now blank.

It must be flashed and optionally initialized with a system identifier in order to be used with a supported game.

prompt.locked: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to unlock, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back.
prompt.unlocked: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to continue, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back.

unlockWarning.x76f041:
X76F041 cartridges keep track of how many times a wrong key has been used. If too many unlock attempts fail, they will lock out any further access and thus become PERMANENTLY BRICKED, with no way to restore access.

Are you sure the key is correct?
unlockWarning.x76f100:
X76F100 cartridges keep track of how many times a wrong key has been used. If too many unlock attempts fail, the cartridge will self-erase and will have to be reinitialized to factory data and paired to the system again if the game requires it.

Are you sure the key is correct?
unlockWarning.zs01:
ZS01 cartridges keep track of how many times a wrong key has been used. If too many unlock attempts fail, the cartridge will self-erase and will have to be reinitialized to factory data and paired to the system again if the game requires it.

Are you sure the key is correct?

ChecksumScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Storage device checksums
ChecksumScreen.description: All checksums are computed using the standard CRC32 algorithm and parameters (polynomial 04C11DB7, initial value FFFFFFFF, input and output reflected, output bits negated).

FileBrowserScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Select file
FileBrowserScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back
FileBrowserScreen.subdirError:
An error occurred while enumerating files in the selected subdirectory. The filesystem may be corrupted or otherwise inaccessible.

Path: %s
Press the Test button to view debug logs.

FilePickerScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Select IDE drive
FilePickerScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back
FilePickerScreen.noDeviceError:
No drives have been found and successfully initialized on the IDE bus. Make sure the drives are appropriately configured as primary or secondary and are receiving power.

Press the Test button to view debug logs.
FilePickerScreen.atapiError:
Failed to initialize the CD-ROM drive or access the filesystem on it. Your drive might be incompatible with the ATAPI driver used by this tool.

Press the Test button to view debug logs.
FilePickerScreen.ideError:
Failed to initialize the drive or access the filesystem on it. Turn off the system and make sure the drive is connected to the IDE bus properly, set as secondary (if a CD-ROM drive is also present) and formatted with a single FAT16, FAT32 or exFAT partition.

Press the Test button to view debug logs.
FilePickerScreen.noFilesError: No files or directories have been found in the root of the selected drive's filesystem.

HexdumpScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Cartridge dump
HexdumpScreen.prompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to scroll. Press {START_BUTTON} to go back.

IDEInfoScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} IDE device information
IDEInfoScreen.prompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to scroll. Press {START_BUTTON} to go back.

KeyEntryScreen.title: Enter unlocking key
KeyEntryScreen.body:
Enter the 8-byte key this cartridge was last locked with.

Use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to move the cursor, hold {START_BUTTON} and use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to edit the highlighted digit.

MainMenuScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Main menu
MainMenuScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to move, select by pressing {START_BUTTON}

cartInfo.name: Manage security cartridge
cartInfo.prompt: Display information about, unlock, dump and manipulate the contents of the inserted security cartridge (if any).

storageInfo.name: Manage flash, PCMCIA cards, RTC and BIOS ROM
storageInfo.prompt: Display information about, dump and manipulate the contents of the system's built-in storage devices or any inserted PCMCIA flash cards.

ideInfo.name: View IDE device and filesystem information
ideInfo.prompt: Display information about the connected IDE/ATAPI devices and mounted FAT and ISO9660 filesystems (if any).

runExecutable.name: Run executable from CD-ROM or hard drive
runExecutable.prompt: Load and launch a System 573 executable from the CD-ROM, IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).
runExecutable.filePrompt: Note that PlayStation executables built without proper System 573 support will not run unless the watchdog is manually disabled.

setRTCTime.name: Set RTC date and time
setRTCTime.prompt: Adjust the current date and time. Note that the time will not persist after a power cycle if the RTC's internal battery is empty.

setResolution.name: Change screen resolution
setResolution.prompt: Switch to a different screen resolution and aspect ratio. Some monitors and upscalers may not support all resolutions.

about.name: About this tool
about.prompt: View information about this tool, including open source licenses.

ejectCD.name: Eject CD-ROM
ejectCD.prompt: Open the CD-ROM drive's tray. You may use this option if the drive's eject button is not easily accessible on your 573.

reboot.name: Reboot system
reboot.prompt: Restart the system. Swap out the CD-ROM and toggle DIP switch 4 before selecting this option to boot the game installed on this system.

QRCodeScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Cartridge dump
QRCodeScreen.prompt: Scan this code and paste the resulting string into the decodeDump.py script provided alongside this tool to obtain a dump of the cartridge. Press {START_BUTTON} to go back.

ReflashGameScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Select game to convert cartridge to
ReflashGameScreen.prompt: Make sure you select the correct region. Note that cartridges can only be converted for use with games that accept the same cartridge type.
ReflashGameScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back

ResolutionScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Select screen resolution
ResolutionScreen.prompt: Select a resolution appropriate for your monitor or upscaler setup. Note that interlaced modes may be subject to flickering.
ResolutionScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back

RTCTimeScreen.title: Set RTC date and time
RTCTimeScreen.body:
Enter the current date and time. Note that System 573 games only accept years in 1970-2069 range.

Use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to move the cursor, hold {START_BUTTON} and use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to edit the highlighted field.

StorageActionsScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Storage device options
StorageActionsScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back
StorageActionsScreen.cardError:
The selected PCMCIA slot is empty.

Turn off the system and insert a supported PCMCIA linear flash card in order to continue. DO NOT HOTPLUG CARDS; hotplugging may damage both the 573 and the card.

checksum.name: Calculate flash, card, RTC and BIOS ROM checksums
checksum.prompt: Compute and display the CRC32 of the contents of the internal flash memory, RTC RAM, BIOS ROM and any inserted flash cards.

dump.name: Dump flash, cards, RTC and BIOS ROM
dump.prompt: Dump the contents of the internal ROMs and any inserted flash cards to the IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).
dump.confirm:
The contents of the internal flash memory, RTC RAM, BIOS ROM and any inserted PCMCIA flash cards will be dumped and the dumps saved to a new directory in the root of the hard drive or CF card currently configured as secondary on the IDE bus.

Do you wish to proceed?

restore.filePrompt: Note that the contents of the file will be written as-is, without adding or modifying any game-specific headers or checksums.
restore.confirm:
The contents of the selected file will be written to the target device, permanently overwriting any other data currently stored on it. The device will be fully erased prior to writing the new data.

Do you wish to proceed?

rtc.name: Restore RTC RAM from dump
rtc.prompt: Erase RTC memory and restore its contents from a file on the CD-ROM, IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).

flash.name: Restore internal flash from dump
flash.prompt: Erase the system's flash memory and restore its contents from a file on the CD-ROM, IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).

pcmcia1.name: Restore PCMCIA card in slot 1 from dump
pcmcia1.prompt: Erase the flash card and restore its contents from a file on the CD-ROM, IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).

pcmcia2.name: Restore PCMCIA card in slot 2 from dump
pcmcia2.prompt: Erase the flash card and restore its contents from a file on the CD-ROM, IDE hard drive or CF card (if connected).

erase.confirm:
All data currently stored on the selected device will be permanently erased.

Do you wish to proceed?

rtc.name: Erase RTC RAM
rtc.prompt: Wipe all data stored in RTC memory, including any high scores and game settings. The date and time will not be reset.

flash.name: Erase internal flash
flash.prompt: Wipe all data stored in the system's flash memory, including any currently installed game and its assets.

pcmcia1.name: Erase PCMCIA card in slot 1
pcmcia1.prompt: Wipe all data stored in the PCMCIA flash card, including any currently installed game and its assets.

pcmcia2.name: Erase PCMCIA card in slot 2
pcmcia2.prompt: Wipe all data stored in the PCMCIA flash card, including any currently installed game and its assets.

resetFlashHeader.name: Clear internal flash header
resetFlashHeader.prompt: Erase any metadata about the currently installed game from the system's flash memory. All other data will be left as-is.
resetFlashHeader.confirm:
The first 32 bytes of the internal flash memory will be cleared. If a game is currently installed, it will no longer recognize the installation as valid until the header is restored.

Do you wish to proceed?

matchFlashHeader.name: Edit internal flash header (use this system's ID)
matchFlashHeader.prompt: Write metadata to the system's flash memory to ensure a flash dump restored from another 573 or an install disc gets recognized as a valid installation.
matchFlashHeader.confirm:
The first 32 bytes of the internal flash memory will be overwritten with information about the specified game's code and this system's digital I/O board identifier.

Do you wish to proceed?
matchFlashHeader.error: No digital I/O board found. This game requires a digital I/O board to be installed in this system, and its identifier to be present in the internal flash header.

editFlashHeader.name: Edit internal flash header (use custom I/O board ID)
editFlashHeader.prompt: Write metadata to the system's flash memory to ensure a flash dump restored from another 573 or an install disc gets recognized as a valid installation.
editFlashHeader.confirm:
The first 32 bytes of the internal flash memory will be overwritten with information about the specified game's code and the digital I/O board identifier entered.

Do you wish to proceed?

StorageInfoScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Storage device information
StorageInfoScreen.prompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} for more options, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back.

kernelInfo.sony:
Kernel type:	Sony PlayStation kernel
  Kernel version:	%s
  Kernel date:	%04X-%02X-%02X
kernelInfo.openbios:
Kernel type:	OpenBIOS
  Kernel build ID:
    %s

pairing.unsupported: This game does not pair to I/O boards
pairing.thisSystem: Paired to this system's I/O board
pairing.otherSystem: Paired to another system's I/O board

description.unidentified: The flash header contains data for an unsupported game.
description.identified:
The game currently installed on the flash has been identified as:
  %s
  %s
description.noHeader: The flash header is currently blank, but a boot executable is present. If you have just restored a flash dump, use the "Edit internal flash header" option to populate the header.
description.blank: The flash header is currently blank and no boot executable is present. This likely means that the flash has been erased and is currently empty.

SystemIDEntryScreen.title: Edit system identifier
SystemIDEntryScreen.body:
Enter the new digital I/O board's identifier. To obtain the ID of another board, run this tool on its respective system.

Use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to move the cursor, hold {START_BUTTON} and use {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} to edit the highlighted digit.

UnlockKeyScreen.title: {RIGHT_ARROW} Select unlocking key
UnlockKeyScreen.prompt: If the cartridge has been converted before, select the game it was last converted to. If it is currently blank, select 00-00-00-00-00-00-00-00.
UnlockKeyScreen.itemPrompt: {RIGHT_ARROW} Press {START_BUTTON} to select, hold {LEFT_BUTTON}{RIGHT_BUTTON} + {START_BUTTON} to go back

WarningScreen.title: Warning
WarningScreen.body:
This tool is experimental and provided with no warranty whatsoever. It is not guaranteed to work and improper usage may PERMANENTLY BRICK your System 573 security cartridges.

Use this tool at your own risk. Do not proceed if you do not know what you are doing.
